titleStmt.title: J. Q. Ward to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4387

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Cynthiana Ky
Nov 4th 1863
Hon T. E. Bramlette,
Governer of Kentucky:

Inclosed you will find the petition of the jurors in the case of the Commonwealth against James Frazier a free man of color, and of citizens & members of the bar, It is rather voleminous, but I would most respectfully ask of you to consider the case as it seems to be one so justly derserving of mercy. I made the questtion as to the constitutionality of the law of March 3rd 1860, And it
might be that if you would notice that you would be the more inclined to pardon him. Hopeing that the case will meet with favorable consideration from you and that I may hear froom you soon I am with great respect

Your Friend & obt Servt,
J, Q, Ward

Harrison Cir Ct
vs
James Frazier
Felony
Pardoned 5th Nov/63

Hon Thos
Gov Ky --
Frankfort, Ky
